definition: to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
tumult/uproar/commotion/disturbance
to deceive/to coax/to amuse (a child)
variant of 鬨|哄[hong4]
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)

sentences.english: The unruly youths soon cleared off when they saw the policeman coming.
sentences.chinese: 这些瞎起哄的青年看到警察来了就迅速溜掉。

sentences.english: The crowd hooted at the speaker.
No longer were his lectures greeted with sneers and catcalls.
sentences.chinese: 他的课不再遭到嘲讽和“嘘嘘”的起哄声。

sentences.english: They jeered the speaker off the stage .
sentences.chinese: 他们起哄把演讲人赶下台。

sentences.english: creating disturbances in a public place, thus causing serious disorder in such place.
sentences.chinese: 在公共场所起哄闹事，造成公共场所秩序严重混乱的。

sentences.english: I heard some of the audience heckle me with loud whistles.
sentences.chinese: 那天，我听到观众中有人大声吹口哨向我起哄。

sentences.english: The crowd began to barrack the visiting team.
sentences.chinese: 观众开始朝客队喝彩起哄。

sentences.english: He went to heckle at their meetings.
Heckling is disrespectful to the person wo is trying to talk.
sentences.chinese: 当别人要说话的时候起哄是很无礼的。

sentences.english: Flank a few man kids in addition to exceed grams to all emulate to build a big rumpus.
sentences.chinese: 旁边几个男孩子除了迈克以外都跟着起哄。

sentences.english: The heckler was ejected from the auditorium for creating a disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 起哄捣蛋分子因制造骚乱被赶出礼堂。

definition: to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
din
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
bluster/ruckus/to boast loudly
to shout/to bellow one's grievances
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to whisper
to boo or jeer (as a sign of displeasure at an actor)
to whisper to one another's ear
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
